intro: Cypella peruviana subsp. communis, commonly known as the Peruvian cypella, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving at high altitudes. Its small, white or greenish flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. The subspecies communis is distinguished by its more widespread distribution compared to other subspecies of Cypella peruviana.
